01birthday-sign1.description: Saturday was Felix's birthday party. Felix made a sign in woodshop at school, so that his guests would find the party easily.
01birthday-sign1.title: Birthday Sign 1

02birthday-sign2.description: Nana hasn't missed a single birthday.
02birthday-sign2.title: Birthday Sign 2

04evan.description: Felix invited all his friends to his party. Everyone showed up except for one chicken pox casualty. Evan crossed the Bay Bridge for the occasion.
04evan.title: Evan

06phoebe.description: Phoebe is in kindergarten now and looks all grown up. She still likes to goof around, though.
06phoebe.title: Phoebe

08incredible.description: Mr Incredible himself made an appearance!
08incredible.title: Incredible

09phin.description: Dora the Explorer was also there, to the delight of Phineas.
09phin.title: Phin

11pinata-austin.description:
Felix really wanted a Felix the Cat pinata. Lucie made an incredible one in papier mache.

Austin played the pinata master, keeping it swinging (or not) depending on the skill level of the kid.
11pinata-austin.title: Pinata Austin

12pinata-felix.description: Felix gets the first shot at Felix.
12pinata-felix.title: Pinata Felix

13pinata-sofia.description: Sofia plots the next blow... the cheek perhaps?
13pinata-sofia.title: Pinata Sofia

14pinata-evan.description:
Yes! Evan made a sizable dent in the swinging cat head.

Applying lessons learned at previous parties, Lucie built a very thin-skinned pinata. Typical pinatas are way too sturdy for the 6-and-under crowd.
14pinata-evan.title: Pinata Evan

15pinata-nate.description: Nate concentrates, determined to finish the flying feline.  Alas, the cat was too crafty.
15pinata-nate.title: Pinata Nate

16pinata-jasper.description: Jasper hits it hard enough to send candy flying, but most of the loot hangs tough.
16pinata-jasper.title: Pinata Jasper

17pinata-zara.description: The suspense builds.  Many think Zara will be the one, but Felix the Pinata again stands firm against the onslaught.
17pinata-zara.title: Pinata Zara

18pinata-henry.description: Now the little ones get a chance to go for the glory. Henry gives it his best shot.
18pinata-henry.title: Pinata Henry

20pinata-alex.description: Alex, Sofia's older brother, is the one to put Felix out of his misery.
20pinata-alex.title: Pinata Alex

22post-pinata2.description: Felix poses next to the shredded pinata. Sofia takes the opportunity to bestow a big smooch.
22post-pinata2.title: Post Pinata 2

24post-pinata4.description: Half-destroyed pinatas make excellent masks. And Keenan made an excellent tickle monster.
24post-pinata4.title: Post Pinata 4

25cake1.description: Felix requested 2 cakes for his birthday: one Moon-shaped, one Earth-shaped. This is the Moon cake, complete with moon rocks (the same chocolate rocks he coveted on Kahlil's cake). I am sorry to report the cosmonauts are not edible.
25cake1.title: Cake 1

26cake2.description: Felix combats global warming. Blow, Felix!
26cake2.title: Cake 2

27cake3.description: What would you like? A slice of Earth or a slice of Moon?
27cake3.title: Cake 3

28mayhem.description: Pinata candy + chocolate cake = sugar-induced mayhem. This is Sofia, Felix, Owen, and, somewhere under them, Alex.
28mayhem.title: Mayhem

29keenan.description: Keenan had a gaggle of little kids swarming him at all times.
29keenan.title: Keenan

30parents.description: We even managed to sneak in some adult conversation while the kids buzzed around.
30parents.title: Parents

31presents1.description: Felix's first present was a neat knight costume from Jasper. He used the plastic sword to open all his other presents.
31presents1.title: Presents 1

32presents2.description: A cool science kit from Granny!
32presents2.title: Presents 2

reading.description: Milo loves books. He likes to look at the thumbnails at the back, and spot which books he already has in the series.
reading.title: Reading

train.description: Owen came again the day after the party, to help Felix break in all his new stuff. Owen likes to wear Felix's astronaut costume whenever he visits.
train.title: Train

tree1.description: As soon as the last scrap of birthday wrapping paper was in the recycle bin, we begain Christmas!
tree1.title: Tree 1

tree2.description: Felix took great pride in decorating the tree, which he did pretty much single-handedly.
tree2.title: Tree 2

tree3.description: He made a story about each ornament, and how it would go around the tree at night and talk to its friend ornaments.
tree3.title: Tree 3

veryfirstphoto.description: Nana's birthday present to Felix was a digital camera. It's from Fischer Price: very easy to use and sturdy enough to be dropped on the floor. This is Felix' very first photo ever!
veryfirstphoto.title: Veryfirstphoto

description:
Felix turns 5 tomorrow, Monday the 11th. We had his party on Saturday. He had a blast and so did his umpteen billion pint-sized guests. Actually, no longer so pint-sized: they all looked like full bore kids, not a trace of toddler left in them!

Midweek the party looked to be in jeopardy. Milo got a stomach virus and spent all Wednesday night barfing. Felix and Dean followed like dominoes the next night. We kept Felix home on Friday to recuperate and luckily Lucie's stomach proved to be made of sterner, more impervious material. The household made a full recovery for Saturday's party.

Update on Dean's gray hair: it's been confirmed by multiple people, including Nana. There's more of it than last week. Dean doesn't mind it... he's planning on being a silverback gorilla next Halloween.
title: December 10
